Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Avion Burbank is a strategically located, 60-acre campus with six industrial buildings, 15K SF of retail, nine office buildings, and an upscale hotel.
Rare opportunity to purchase or lease the creative office buildings which feature high-quality designs by Gensler, and plug-and-play open areas.
This live/work/play community fosters collaboration through multi-purpose paths, outdoor gathering space, and recreational activities.
A quarter-mile to I-5, adjacent to the Metrolink Station, and immediate access to Hollywood Burbank Airport, all makes for unmatched connectivity.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Avion Burbank is a strategically located 60-acre, 17-building, mixed-use campus featuring state-of-the-art construction in a collaborative community with multi-purpose paths, outdoor gathering space, and recreational activities. Inspired by such iconic figures in aviation as Amelia Earhart and Lockheed Aircraft Chief Research Engineer Clarence L. "Kelly" Johnson, Avion Burbank represents the value of creativity and innovation through cutting-edge designs by Gensler and HPA. Avion Burbank will consist of six Creative Industrial buildings, nine two-story Creative Office buildings, a 150-room upscale hotel, and approximately 15,000 square feet of retail at the gateway. The Creative Office buildings offer the rare opportunity to purchase or lease, and will feature plug-and-play open areas ideal for meetings and group collaboration. The hotel will feature a business center, fitness center, swimming pool, conference facilities, and a restaurant, providing the offices with all the amenities needed for meeting and hosting guests. The Creative Industrial buildings are on fully secured yards with 8-foot wrought iron fences and will include build-to-suit office space. These buildings will have 30- to 32-foot clear heights, 50- by 52-foot column spacing, and 124'1"- to 135' truck courts. They will also feature ESFR sprinkler systems, 2,000 to 3,000 amps of power, and electric vehicle charging stations. The retail buildings in Avion Burbank will be at the signalized intersection of Tulare Avenue and N Hollywood Way, allowing for easy access and convenient parking for customers. The open-air plaza will offer outdoor patios with dining areas and abundant green spaces. Avion Burbank reflects the City of Burbank's unique place in aerospace history as the site of extraordinary achievements in aircraft design, engineering, and manufacturing. Avion Burbank's pedestrian-friendly facilities and work/lifestyle amenities attract and retain a skilled and motivated employee base — supporting productivity and performance. Twelve miles northeast of Los Angeles, Avion Burbank is between the Hollywood Burbank Airport and Interstate 5/Golden State Freeway, just a quarter-mile to the on- and off-ramps for Interstate 5 and adjacent to the Antelope Valley Metrolink Station. Avion Burbank offers unparalleled access to all modes of transportation, and the support of a progressive and business-friendly city government focused on thoughtful, creative development that will benefit not only business but also the entire Burbank community.
